A test_result stores errors (from thrown exceptions) and failures (from assertions) from a test run.

Member functions

{{macros.member_item("(constructor)", "Constructs the test_result", "public member function", "constructor.html")}} {{macros.member_item("(destructor)", "Destructs the test_result", "public member function", "")}} {{macros.member_item("add_error", "Adds a std::exception as an error to this test result", "public member function")}} {{macros.member_item("add_failure", "Adds a std::exception as a failure to this test result", "public member function")}} {{macros.member_item("errors", "Returns the current errors of this test_result", "public member function")}} {{macros.member_item("failures", "Returns the current failures of this test_result", "public member function")}} {{macros.member_item("passed", "Checks whether this test_result has passed", "public member function")}} {% endblock %}
